paper_abstract: Denote by J(nu) the Bessel function of the first kind of order.nu and mu(nu,k) is its kth positive zero. For nu > 1/2, a theorem of Lorch, Muldoon and Szego states that the sequence {integral(mu nu,k) (mu nu,k+1) x(-nu)vertical bar J(nu) (x)vertical bar d(x)} is decreasing, another theorem of theirs states that the sequence {integral mu(-2(nu-1))(nu,k) J(nu-1)(2)( mu(nu,k))}(k=1)(infinity) has higher monotonicity properties. In the present paper, we proved that when nu > 1/2 the sequence {integral(mu nu,k+1)(mu nu,k) x(-nu+1)vertical bar J(nu)(x)vertical bar d(x)} has higher monotonicity properties and the properties imply those of the sequence of the local maxima of the function x(-nu+1)vertical bar J(nu-1)(x)vertical bar, x is an element of( 0,infinity), i.e. the sequence {mu(-(nu-1))(nu,k)vertical bar J(nu-1)( mu(nu,k))vertical bar}(k=1)(infinity) has higher monotonicity properties.
paper_title: Higher monotonicity properties of normalized Bessel functions
